intro: Chamaesyce adhaerens, commonly known as the clinging weed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
